tit.e: Sansai-ryu School (a school of tea ceremony)

sen.j: 三斎流（さんさいりゅう）は、細川三斎を祖と仰ぐ茶道の一派。
sen.e: Sansai-ryu (Sansai School) is a school of sado (tea ceremony), which was established by Sansai HOSOKAWA.
Sansai-ryu school is a school of tea ceremony, which regards Sansai HOSOKAWA as the founder.

sen.j: 三斎の門人である一尾伊織が許しを得て興したので一尾流（いちおりゅう）、三斎流一尾派などとも言われる。
sen.e: Because Iori ICHIO, who was a disciple of Sansai, started a faction upon receiving the permission from his master, the school is also referred to as Ichio-ryu (Ichio School) or Sansai-ryu Ichio-ha (Ichio Faction of the Sansai School).

sen.e: Although it is known for the fact that Iori ICHIO was goshoinban (a shogun's body guard or the castle guard) of the bakufu (a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and a hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) who was worth 1,000 koku (approximately 180,000 liters of crop yield; 1 koku was about 180 liter; an old unit showing volume), little is known about the details of his relationship to Sansai.

sen.e: It is said that while at the beginning Iori ICHIO learned the tea ceremony from Shogen SATO, a vassal of Sansai, he later became the disciple of Sansai himself, and eventually started his own faction upon receiving the permission from his master.
